bibl.title: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, March 2, 1948

div1.p: Law reports that the Wyeth company is cooperating with the Hall of Fame. He inquires about the possibility of a residency position at the Mayo Clinic for a young doctor whom he has sponsored.

div1.head: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, March 2, 1948

WYETH
INCORPORATED
1600 ARCH STREET · PHILADELPHIA 3, PA.
March 2, 1948
OFFICE OF VICE PRESIDENT
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We received a call from the Hall of Fame in New York about
supplying plates for their program on the Yellow Fever exhibit
and ceremonies which will be held on May 16. Miss Lyons
advised that you had given her my name, which was quite in order.

I have asked Mr. Roley, who handles our publicity work on
these paintings, to cooperate in every way possible. I have not
yet heard any details of the program but we shall be glad to be
of assistance.

I am more or less sponsoring a young man, Thomas Noone, in
his career as a doctor and on Sunday, while he was visiting my
home, I asked him what he plans to do after he has served his
internship at Cooper Hospital on June 30. He said he would like
to get an internship or fellowship in O.B. or G.U. work in some
hospital because the residencies at Cooper are mortgaged until
1952.

When I jokingly asked him if he would be interested in the
Mayo Clinic he said this was far beyond his dreams and could not
see any such possibility. I do not know what the requirements
are or whether there is a chance of a fellowship at the Clinic
but thought I would ask you if there is any opportunity for a
bright young man to make the grade there.

He attended the University of Pennsylvania on the acceler-
ated pre-medical program during the war and after that Dr. Eben
Carey of Marquette reviewed his marks and admitted him to that
school. He graduated in the upper third in a class of 88. I
then sponsored him at Cooper Hospital in Camden for internship,
where he will finish in June.

He is now only 23 years old and feels he could spend
several years as a resident and then really be fitted to go into
Wyeth
WYETH
INCORPORATED
1600 ARCH STREET · PHILADELPHIA 3, PA.
March 2, 1948
OFFICE OF VICE PRESIDENT
Dr. P. S. Hench
Rochester, Minnesota

practice.

If you have any thoughts in this matter, I would be glad to
hear from you, as I would like to see Tom go through.
With kind personal regards, I am
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Frank Law FFL:s
Wyeth
